tit.e: Mokugyo (a fish-shaped wooden drum) 木魚
tit.cmt: 後文との漢字の違いを明確にするために表記しています。
漢字表記を次行に移動

sen.j: 木魚（もくぎょ、杢魚とも）とは、仏具の一種である。
sen.e: Mokugyo (a fish-shaped wooden drum) (also written in 杢魚) is a kind of butsugu (Buddhist altar fittings).
sen.cmt: 前文との漢字の違いを明確にするために表記しています。
sen.e: Mokugyo (木魚; a fish-shaped wooden drum) (also written in 杢魚) is a kind of butsugu (Buddhist altar fittings).
Mokugyo (木魚; a fish-shaped wooden drum) (also written in 杢魚) is a kind of butsugu (Buddhist altar fittings).

sen.j: 木魚は、読経をするときに打ち鳴らすことで、リズムを整える。
sen.e: Mokugyo (a fish-shaped wooden drum) is intended to keep the rhythm of sutra chanting by beating and sounding.
Mokugyo (a fish-shaped wooden drum) is intended to keep the rhythm of sutra chanting by beating and sounding.
Mokugyo (a fish-shaped wooden drum) is intended to keep the rhythm of sutra chanting by beating and sounding.

sen.j: また、眠気覚ましの意味もある。
sen.e: It also helps to awaken people in sutra chanting.
It also helps to awaken people in sutra chanting.
It also helps to awaken people in sutra chanting.

sen.j: 禅宗や天台宗、浄土宗などで用いられる。
sen.e: It is used in Zen sect, Tendai sect, and Jodo Sect.
It is used in Zen sect, Tendai sect, and Jodo sect.
sen.cmt: Sectの頭文字を小文字に変更
sen.e: It is used in Zen sect, Tendai sect, and Jodo sect.

sen.j: 浄土宗では木魚の使用が禁じられた時期もあったが、その後念仏を唱えるときに使用されるようになった。
sen.e: The use of Mokugyo was once prohibited in Jodo Sect, but afterward, it came to be used when sutra is chanted.
The use of Mokugyo was once prohibited in Jodo sect, but afterward, it came to be used when sutra was chanted.
sen.cmt: Sectの頭文字を小文字に変更、is→wasとしました。
sen.e: The use of Mokugyo was once prohibited in Jodo sect, but afterward, it came to be used when sutra was chanted.

sen.j: 小さな座布団状の台の上に置かれ、先端を布で巻いたバチで叩くと、「ぽくぽく」という感じの音が鳴る。
sen.e: It is placed on a small zabuton (traditional Japanese cushions used to sit on the floor)-like table, and it sounds like `poku poku' when it is beaten with a plectrum whose top is wrapped in cloth.
It is placed on a small zabuton (traditional Japanese cushions used to sit on the floor)-like table, and it sounds like 'poku poku' when it is beaten with a plectrum whose top is wrapped in cloth.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション修正
sen.e: It is placed on a small zabuton (traditional Japanese cushions used to sit on the floor)-like table, and it sounds like 'poku poku' when it is beaten with a plectrum whose top is wrapped in cloth.

sen.j: 大きさは直径6cm程度から、1m近いものまである。
sen.e: It ranges in size from about 6cm to the size close to 1m in diameter
It ranges in size from about six centimeters to the size close to one meter in diameter.
sen.cmt: six centimeters、one meterとし、ピリオド追加
sen.e: It ranges in size from about six centimeters to the size close to one meter in diameter.

sen.j: 自らの尾を食う魚や、2匹の魚や龍が珠を争う姿などを図案化した鈴のような形をしている。
sen.e: It looks like a bell which is designed from a fish eating its own tail, or two fishes and a dragon competing for a gem.
It looks like a bell which is designed from a fish eating its own tail, or two fishes and a dragon competing for a gem.
It looks like a bell which is designed from a fish eating its own tail, or two fishes and a dragon competing for a gem.

sen.j: 表面には魚の鱗が彫刻されている。
sen.e: The uroko (scale pattern) of fish is carved on its surface.
The uroko (scale pattern) of fish is carved on its surface.
The uroko (scale pattern) of fish is carved on its surface.

sen.j: クスノキなどの木を材料としてつくられる。
sen.e: It is made from wood like camphor tree.
It is made from wood like camphor tree.
It is made from wood like camphor tree.

sen.j: 内部は空洞になっている。
sen.e: The inside of Mokugyo is hollowed.
The inside of Mokugyo is hollowed.
The inside of Mokugyo is hollowed.

sen.j: 開口部である「響孔」にあたる部分から刃を入れ、内部に空洞が作られる。
sen.e: It is cut from an opening; `sound hole' of Mokugyo to make a hollow inside.
It is cut from an opening; 'sound hole' of Mokugyo to make a hollow inside.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション修正、スペース消去
sen.e: It is cut from an opening; 'sound hole' of Mokugyo to make a hollow inside.

sen.j: 木魚の原型は禅で使われていた「魚板」（魚鼓）である。
sen.e: The original model of Mokugyo is `gyoban' (wooden gong shaped like a fish) (wooden gong shaped like a fish) which was used in Zen.
The original model of Mokugyo is 'gyoban' or 'gyoku' (wooden gong shaped like a fish) which was used in Zen.
sen.cmt: or 'gyoku'追加、(wooden gong shaped like a fish)→重複しているため削除
sen.e: The original model of Mokugyo is 'gyoban' or 'gyoku' (wooden gong shaped like a fish) which was used in Zen.

sen.j: 魚板とはその名の通り魚の形をした板であり、たたき鳴らすことで人を集める合図とした。
sen.e: Gyoban (wooden gong shaped like a fish) is a fish-shaped board as its name suggests, and it was beaten to give a signal to call people together.
Gyoban (wooden gong shaped like a fish) is a fish-shaped board as its name suggests, and it was beaten to give a signal to call people together.
Gyoban (wooden gong shaped like a fish) is a fish-shaped board as its name suggests, and it was beaten to give a signal to call people together.

sen.j: 魚の形をしているのは、魚は日夜を問わず目を閉じないことから、修行に精進することの象徴であったためとされる。
sen.e: It is believed that its fish-like shape is a symbol of devoting one to training since a fish never closes its eyes at any time during the day or night.
It is believed that its fish-like shape was a symbol of devoting one to training since a fish never closes its eyes at any time during the day or night.
It is believed that its fish-like shape was a symbol of devoting one to training since a fish never closes its eyes at any time during the day or night.

sen.j: そして、魚の腹をたたくことで煩悩を吐き出させる、という意味合いが有ったともされる。
sen.e: It is also considered that beating the belly of fish helps one throw up his/her earthly desires.
It is also considered that beating the belly of fish helped one throw up his/her earthly desires.
It is also considered that beating the belly of fish helped one throw up his/her earthly desires.

sen.j: そして雑学だが、眠気覚ましの為に一定ののリズムを刻んでいたとも言われる。
sen.e: This may be extra information, but it is said that it made steady rhythms in order to keep people awake.
This may be extra information, but it is said that it made steady rhythms in order to keep people awake.
This may be extra information, but it is said that it made steady rhythms in order to keep people awake.

sen.j: 明代には、現代の木魚の形が確立している。
sen.e: By the Ming Dynasty, the shape of Mokugyo that is seen today was established.
By the Ming Dynasty, the shape of Mokugyo that is seen today was established.
By the Ming Dynasty, the shape of Mokugyo that is seen today was established.

sen.j: 江戸時代の初めに渡来した隠元和尚が、日本に広めたといわれている。
sen.e: It is said that Ingen Osho, who came from abroad in the early edo period, spread it in Japan.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is said that Ingen Osho, who came from abroad in the early Edo period, spread it in Japan.
It is said that Ingen Osho, who came from abroad in the early Edo period, spread it in Japan.

sen.j: 室町時代の木魚も遺されている。
sen.e: Mokugyo of the Muromashi period has also been handed down.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Mokugyo of the Muromashi period has also been handed down.
Mokugyo of the Muromashi period has also been handed down.

sen.j: 木魚を楽器としてみれば、一種のスリットドラムである。
sen.e: Considering Mokugyo as an instrument, it is a kind of slit drum.
Considering Mokugyo as an instrument, it is a kind of slit drum.
Considering Mokugyo as an instrument, it is a kind of slit drum.

sen.j: すなわち、中空の木片の一部にスリットを入れたものである。
sen.e: That is, it is a hollow piece of wood with a slit.
That is, it is a hollow piece of wood with a slit.
That is, it is a hollow piece of wood with a slit.

sen.j: 乾隆帝時代の清では民衆音楽に楽器として用いられた。
sen.e: In Qing in the period of Chien Lung, it was used as an instrument for popular music.
In Qing in the period of Chien Lung, it was used as an instrument for popular music.
In Qing in the period of Chien Lung, it was used as an instrument for popular music.

sen.j: 日本でも歌舞伎で用いられることがある。
sen.e: In Japan, it is sometimes used in Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors).
In Japan, it is sometimes used in Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors).
In Japan, it is sometimes used in Kabuki (traditional drama performed by male actors).

sen.j: ベトナムでは「モー」と呼ばれ、打楽器として用いられる。
sen.e: In Vietnam, it is called `Mo,' and is used as a percussion instrument.
In Vietnam, it is called 'Mo,' and is used as a percussion instrument.
sen.cmt: クォーテーション修正
sen.e: In Vietnam, it is called 'Mo,' and is used as a percussion instrument.

sen.j: 第二次世界大戦後には、ジャズやクラシック音楽にも取り入れられた。
sen.e: After the World War II, it has been used in the Jazz or classic music.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: After the World War II, it has been used in the Jazz or classic music.
After the World War II, it has been used in the Jazz or classic music.

sen.j: テンプル・ブロック、チャイニーズ・ブロックともよばれ、2個から5個を一組に使用する場合が多い。
sen.e: It is also called temple block, or Chinese block, and between two and five Mokugyo are often used together.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: It is also called temple block, or Chinese block, and between two and five Mokugyo are often used together.
It is also called temple block, or Chinese block, and between two and five Mokugyo are often used together.

sen.j: 高音で堅く鋭い音色のウッド・ブロックに比べると、木魚は柔らかく響きもふくよかである。
sen.e: Compared with wood block, which has high tone with a hard and sharp tone color, the tone color of Mokugyo is soft and it sounds fertile.
Compared with wood block, which has high tone with a hard and sharp tone color, the tone color of Mokugyo is soft and it sounds fertile.
Compared with wood block, which has high tone with a hard and sharp tone color, the tone color of Mokugyo is soft and it sounds fertile.

tit.j: 木魚が使用される主な楽曲
tit.e: Music composition in which Mokugyo is used
Music composition in which Mokugyo is used
Music composition in which Mokugyo is used

sen.j: テンプル・ブロックもしくはウッドブロックで演奏される場合もある。
sen.e: It may be played in temple block or wood block.
It may be played in temple block or wood block.
It may be played in temple block or wood block.

sen.j: 青少年のための管弦楽入門
sen.e: The Young Person's Guide to the Orchestra
The Young Person's Guide to the Orchestra
The Young Person's Guide to the Orchestra

sen.j: 他
sen.e: Others
Others
Others

sen.j: 朝鮮民謡の主題による変奏曲
sen.e: Variations with a theme of Korean Folk Song
Variations with a theme of Korean Folk Song
Variations with a theme of Korean Folk Song

sen.j: 呪文と踊り
sen.e: Incantation and Dance
Incantation and Dance
Incantation and Dance

sen.j: 他
sen.e: Others
Others
Others

sen.j: J-POP、その他の音楽
sen.e: J-POP, other music
J-POP, other music
J-POP, other music

sen.j: 明和電機の諸アルバムやシングル
sen.e: Various albums or single songs of Maywa Denki
Various albums or single songs of Maywa Denki
Various albums or single songs of Maywa Denki

sen.j: 指パッチンをする事により指に取り付けられたセンサーを通し、伝わった動きでアームの先端に取り付けられたバチが動く。
sen.e: The plectrum installed in the end of an arm is moved due to the sensor fitted onto fingers, to which the movement of fingers is transmitted when fingers are snapped
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The plectrum installed in the end of an arm is moved due to the sensor fitted onto fingers, to which the movement of fingers is transmitted when fingers are snapped.
The plectrum installed in the end of an arm is moved due to the sensor fitted onto fingers, to which the movement of fingers is transmitted when fingers are snapped.

sen.j: 同じく先端に取り付けられた木魚を演奏出来る「パチモク」なる楽器を制作し、使用している。
sen.e: The instrument called `bachimoku', which enables to play Mokugyo installed in the end, is used as well.
sen.cmt: 一原文・一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: The instrument called 'pachimoku,' which enables to play Mokugyo installed in the end, is used as well.
sen.cmt: bachimoku→pachimokuに修正、カンマの位置を移動、クォーテーション修正
sen.e: The instrument called 'pachimoku,' which enables to play Mokugyo installed in the end, is used as well.

sen.j: 魚屋のオッサンの唄（あのねのね）
sen.e: Uoya no Ossan no uta (the song of a master of a fish shop) (by Anonenone)
Sakanaya no Ossan no uta (the song of a master of a fish shop) (by Anonenone)
Sakanaya no Ossan no uta (the song of a master of a fish shop) (by Anonenone)

sen.j: 清水国明の弟子でもあった嘉門達夫の歌曲にも効果音に木魚を使用した作品がある。
sen.e: In a song of Tatsuo KAMON, who was a disciple of Kuniaki SHIMIZU, Mokugyo is used for special effects.
In a song of Tatsuo KAMON, who was a disciple of Kuniaki SHIMIZU, Mokugyo is used for special effects.
In a song of Tatsuo KAMON, who was a disciple of Kuniaki SHIMIZU, Mokugyo is used for special effects.

sen.j: 國府田マリ子のシングル「夢はひとりみるものじゃない」のイントロでも木魚の音が聞ける為、使用されている様である。
sen.e: It sounds like Mokugyo is used in the intro of the song `Yume ha hitori de mirumono jya nai (a dream can't be dreamed alone)' which is a single of Mariko KODA.
It sounds like Mokugyo is used in the intro of the song 'Yume ha hitori de mirumono ja nai' (a dream can't be dreamed alone) which is a single of Mariko KODA.
sen.cmt: jya→jaに修正、クォーテーション修正・位置を移動
sen.e: It sounds like Mokugyo is used in the intro of the song 'Yume ha hitori de mirumono ja nai' (a dream can't be dreamed alone) which is a single of Mariko KODA.
